storyInfo: Following the close of the war, Speaker Vina must handle the thorny issue of the Sarkaz left behind. But she does not hesitate. The moment she took up the mantle of Speaker, she knew what she would have to face.

attributes.content: <p=1>Londinium, Abandoned Factory</><p=2>December 8th, 1098, 4:43 P.M.</>
attributes.name: group_location_stamp

attributes.content: Section G12... All these linkage numbers have faded away since this place was abandoned... Is this it?
attributes.name: Calm Lady

attributes.content: *phew* I'm praying I don't run into those damned devils again—
attributes.name: Calm Lady

attributes.content: I think you're lost, lady.
attributes.name: Cautious Mercenary

attributes.content: (Hey, new guy, get her out of here. And while you're at it, ask her nicely how she found this place.)
attributes.name: Cautious Mercenary

attributes.content: (Remember, keep your tail clean this time. Don't make the boss mad.)
attributes.name: Cautious Mercenary

attributes.content: You heard him, lady. Come with me—
attributes.name: Tired Mercenary

attributes.content: Let go of me!
attributes.name: Calm Lady

attributes.content: Is this any way to treat a lady?
attributes.name: Calm Lady

attributes.content: Mickey Robinson, hero of the Exemplars... Or rather, one of the heroes, is my husband. He entrusted me to fetch some medicine.
attributes.name: Calm Lady

attributes.content: Th-The medicine to dull the pain from those hideous black stones. He can hardly even walk...
attributes.name: Calm Lady

attributes.content: Hah, yet another unlucky bugger—
attributes.name: Tired Mercenary

attributes.content: Shut it.
attributes.name: Cautious Mercenary

attributes.content: Listen, I haven't heard of any Mickey.
attributes.name: Cautious Mercenary

attributes.content: All you'll find in this blasted place are some bum's expired fun drugs and the dead devils' bones.
attributes.name: Cautious Mercenary

attributes.content: But—
attributes.name: Calm Lady

attributes.content: Anyways, if you want Oripathy meds, go look for that newly-built Sanatorium. The new Speaker lady promised it'd be stocked.
attributes.name: Cautious Mercenary

attributes.content: Wait, we really have no other choice. There's simply not enough medicine there.
attributes.name: Calm Lady

attributes.content: I know I can get it here. My husband, he...
attributes.name: Calm Lady

attributes.content: Listen, I have a few valuables stashed away somewhere safe, all from Cumberland Manor. The late duke gave them to us. If I could just get some medicine—
attributes.name: Calm Lady

attributes.content: Don't give a reason for the Defense Forces patrolling out there to come sniffing around here.
attributes.name: Cautious Mercenary

attributes.content: Just go already, lady.
attributes.name: Tired Mercenary

attributes.content: Make her sign the list, then let her come by tomorrow to pick up the meds.
attributes.name: Voice on the Terminal

attributes.content: Yes, boss! But what if she doesn't have the money...?
attributes.name: Cautious Mercenary

attributes.content: We do it the old-fashioned way then.
attributes.name: Voice on the Terminal

attributes.content: That's weird, I don't think the boss ever stuck her nose into this sort of thing. Err, what should I...?
attributes.name: Tired Mercenary

attributes.content: Hmph. Just give her the contract.
attributes.name: Cautious Mercenary

attributes.content: Thank you, tha—Wait, these clauses... My husband never mentioned them! If I signed this, then we...
attributes.name: Calm Lady

attributes.content: He'll live well, at least before we come calling for our due.
attributes.name: Cautious Mercenary

attributes.content: Seems that hero husband of yours wasn't quite so honest with his better half, eh?
attributes.name: Cautious Mercenary

attributes.content: C'mon, hold that pen steady. If you can't, we can sign it for you.
attributes.name: Cautious Mercenary

attributes.content: The mercenary holds her writing hand tight. The trembling overtakes her. She can no longer maintain her veneer of calm.
She shuts her eyes, grits her teeth, and lets the mercenary guide her hand.
Go on, enjoy your life. Bloody war's over, after all.
attributes.name: Cautious Mercenary

attributes.content: Asking Millscar for help will be the best decision you and your husband have ever made, lady.
attributes.name: Cautious Mercenary

attributes.content: This morning, Londinium's interim health-secretary-cum-provisioner-general Madam Major was found dead in her office in New Auchterigg District.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: In today's parliamentary session, Madam Speaker Alexandrina expressed her support of Madam Major's work in caring for the Infected, and lamented her untimely passing.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: The final point in Madam Major's itinerary before she passed was a trip to the Dukedom of Normandy to discuss a purchase of medicine so as to relieve the shortages within Londinium's walls.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: But according to some reliable sources, Madam Major died of an acute Oripathy attack.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: Not only did she conceal her infection, she was also often seen arguing furiously with the Speaker, in recent times.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: In this sensitive period where the number of reported Infected within the city is growing exponentially, it is clearly worth looking into the death of Madam Major, who had lost her hereditary peerage.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: Even now, two months after the Sarkaz withdrawal, why are their sinister plots coming back to the fore?
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: As for the Exemplars, are the terms of the resettlement program still not finalized?
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: All eyes are on the newly-appointed Speaker, who has won the backing of a majority of the dukes.
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: We have managed to connect with the Speaker's close confidant, Miss Kate Morrigan, digging deeper into—
attributes.name: Radio

attributes.content: The broadcast in the Speaker's office suddenly falls silent.
Those louts are a real crock of shit, I tell you!
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: They were loafing about the Sanatorium cafeteria, waiting for me to sit down for lunch before they tried to wheedle some info out of me...
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Then you beat the hell out of them.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I thought... That way, they wouldn't dare run their mouths on the news again...
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Sorry. I didn't think about how it'd affect the way everyone sees you—
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: No, I would have kicked them out too, literally.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Huh? But...
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: It doesn't matter what you say to those newshounds when they're in the business of making up fluff. They've already decided what to put in their latest story a long time ago.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Since there's no way of shutting them up, might as well get straight to the point.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Vina strikes her two fists together, putting herself through the paces engraved in her instincts with ease.
Just like she always did back in the gym.
Hah! That's the Vina I know! I knew it, Hannah even said—
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Whoa.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: These clothes really do get in the way. Maybe I should find someone to make some alterations—
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I happen to know a pretty good tailor.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: He made clothes for the royal family when he was younger. Luckily, he made it through everything alive. Shame nobody dares hire him nowadays.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Infected as well?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: *cough* Ah yeah, any progress on that thing you mentioned in your message?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: The situation is complicated.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: We've captured the Sarkaz who have been hurting people. They're now cuffed in the Sineselde's parliamentary chamber.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I suspect this might have something to do with the gangs operating out of the abandoned underground factories.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Millscar.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: As for whether or not the Duke of Normandy's heir is behind all this—
attributes.name: Delphine
Vina
attributes.content: She and I will resume...

attributes.name: Vina
attributes.content: Negotiations.
Madam Major's death, the Londiniers' medicine supply, as well as Millscar's gang and those Sarkaz...
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: There're a lot of things to handle in this city, and none we can solve with our fists like we did two months ago.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: You've settled into the job quick, Vina. I believe Parliament as it is now can manage these issues, so relax. I'm here to help you.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Mother taught me how to handle this sort of situation. I won't let her down.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Morgan?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I'm heading over to Parliament. See you there.
attributes.name: Voice Outside the Door

attributes.content: She's not quite used to this sort of life yet. None of us are.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: There are some things Siege could do that this so-called Speaker can't.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: How's the victim of the Sarkaz attack?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: In the care of our colleagues at Rhodes Island's medical department. No life-threatening complications, for the time being.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Moreover, we've traced the source of those low-quality medicines. Most of them came from Millscar.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Many turned to them in desperation, but in the end, all they got was a pile of harassment from that gang of wandering goons.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: As for whether this Millscar is in the know, or if it's the work of some overeager underlings, I'm not too sure—
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Allerdale knows.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Millscar. The wildest villain running rampant in Londinium's shadows.
Allerdale. She's dead. The final furious flame of Cumberland the Ever on High.
Vina herself has already forgotten when the figures behind those two names slowly became one.
Was it when the war was nearly over?
She subconsciously paws at her clothes. By the time the Exemplars' 'heroic leader' walked out of the Palace of Westhaleg wearing this old suit of royal armor...
She had already torn down the flag of Kazdel's Military Commission at the break of dawn, and had seen a familiar figure and the Steam Knight fade away into the all-encompassing vapor.
That day, Allerdale did not go to her. Rather, she turned and disappeared into the shadows of the ruined city.
Let's go. To Parliament.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.text: The Sineselde, once a royal estate often rented by nobles as a banquet hall. It wasn't until everyone was dealing with the headache of where to house Parliament that Vina realized there weren't many choices left for the Londiniers.
\nThe chaos of war had destroyed far too much of this city.

I've seen this room many times before on posters and in movies. I used to be astonished by how massive it was, big enough for every gang boss to bring all their boys and girls in to sit down and have a chat about their turfs.
\nBut now, it disappoints me. It's filled to the gills, all cramped and suffocating.
\nThough Vina's never admitted it, I know her and I are of like mind—

attributes.content: (Miss Morgan... Miss Morgan...)
attributes.name: Uneasy MP

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: I didn't mean to interrupt your writing, it's just that... that...
attributes.name: Uneasy MP

attributes.content: (Barnaby's late again, I'm thinking of going to look for him. I'm worried he's gone and gotten himself soused again.)
attributes.name: Uneasy MP
Morgan
attributes.content: Well, Vina's not here yet. If you're gonna look, go look, no need to ask me—

attributes.name: Morgan
attributes.content: Wait!
Now that I think about it, you said the same last time, and the two of you never came back the entire session.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: W-We were just locked out last time...
attributes.name: Uneasy MP

attributes.content: In all honesty, Miss Morgan, I've been carrying around the factory's design sheets for near my entire life.
attributes.name: Uneasy MP

attributes.content: If you asked me to do a quality inspection, I'd know all the ins and outs of whichever part you'd like, and there wasn't a foreman out there who'd dare say I was wrong.
attributes.name: Uneasy MP

attributes.content: But sitting here with those lords and ladies, trying to read these documents covered in gobbledygook so we can manage such a ridiculously huge city...
attributes.name: Uneasy MP

attributes.content: (Biggest thing I've looked after in my life was my workshop. God, my heart's pounding like mad.)
attributes.name: Uneasy MP

attributes.content: With us at your back, why be scared of some tosspot nobles?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: An elegantly-dressed member of parliament's eyes meets Morgan's gaze, and she smiles and nods her head in greeting.
Fine weather we're having today. I hope you are all in good health.
attributes.name: Graceful MP

attributes.content: Ah, yeah. Good health to you too.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: We're fine, just fine, thanks.
attributes.name: Uneasy MP

attributes.content: (Well... Just treat it as helping Vina fill the seats.)
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: (I suppose they're not all tosspots, but keep in mind that we put our lives on the line to take back the right to sit here.)
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: (Are you seriously thinking of going back to the days before that? If so, I'll have to sort you out first before these bastards ruin this city again.)
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Alright, I get it, I get it. Are Miss Indra and Miss Dagda not showing up today?
attributes.name: Uneasy MP

attributes.content: They're busy handling some public safety stuff.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: (*sigh* I'd rather hold my hammer tight and go back to bed too.)
attributes.name: Uneasy MP

attributes.content: Oh, Madam Speaker, you're here—What's this?
attributes.name: Graceful MP

attributes.content: Vina! Wait, who's that you're carrying?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Barnaby!
attributes.name: Uneasy MP

attributes.content: C-Clive...
attributes.name: Drunken MP

attributes.content: Help him to his seat, Delphine.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: He drank until he passed out in front of the Sineselde's doors. Now he won't let go of Vina.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I'm waiting for the Speaker!
attributes.name: Drunken MP

attributes.content: I've got... got a whole lot of proposals to help with the meds shortage—
attributes.name: Drunken MP

attributes.content: Then you should include them in your formal petition. We reformed the rules issued by Parliament all so we could bind ourselves.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Lady Delphine, I swear Barnaby here's not trying to be a simpleton on purpose. He and I have talked about his ideas loads of times!
attributes.name: Uneasy MP

attributes.content: He's just like me, sick to our stomachs the moment we stepped foot into this bloody place, like the soul's getting sucked right out of us. It's not just that we can't speak right, all the brass courage we had while chopping down devils is gone.
attributes.name: Uneasy MP

attributes.content: So I came up with this stupid idea. That maybe a bit of drink would... would...
attributes.name: Uneasy MP

attributes.content: Relax, Vina's not going to get mad over something like that.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Right, you needn't worry. Parliament nowadays is incredibly complex by nature. Everyone here's on the lookout, getting used to things and learning on the job... That includes the Speaker.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: If we're going to defeat those who wish us ill off the battlefield, we're going to have to learn how they think.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: It's not going to be an easy process for any of us. The two of you have done pretty well, all things considered.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: What if we become them once we learn enough about them...?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: I-I certainly won't, Miss Morgan!
attributes.name: Uneasy MP

attributes.content: I'm not saying you will, Clive.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: I can't guarantee that won't be the case, Morgan. Nobody can.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I believe in Vina. So do Hannah and Dagda... I don't care what you all think.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: I'm sure we're all very clear on why we have convened this emergency meeting.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Ever since Parliament was reestablished, we have worked around the clock to resolve the issue of the Sarkaz who continue to operate within Londinium's walls.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: We gave our citizens a promise. A promise of safety.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: It matters not if it is the Sarkaz, or roving mercenaries such as Millscar hiding within the city; Parliament will strive to settle the matter.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: We will brook no evil that threatens the safety of our people.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: ...You're putting me on trial?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Assassin

attributes.content: There will be no trial, Sarkaz. Parliament's new interim bill dictates how we handle you. The provisional court has passed it as well.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: You will be dealt with in a manner that all agree upon.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Not everyone. Just you people.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Assassin

attributes.content: You caused grave injury to a kind-hearted shopkeep, all for a loaf of bread he had already set aside for you.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: He's still alive?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Assassin

attributes.content: He is.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Good. So, when's the execution?
attributes.name: Sarkaz Assassin

attributes.content: You really should have left with the rest of your kind when the war ended.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: You still remember me? Of course you do. You were the one who let me go during the big retreat, after all.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Assassin

attributes.content: I'd say you were my savior, head of the Exemplars.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Assassin

attributes.content: You—
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: 'Longshot'. That's what my daughter calls me. You didn't ask me my name at the time, and I'm betting the people sitting by your side don't give a damn what it is.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Assassin

attributes.content: But I'm going to ask everyone here something, on behalf of a few others.
attributes.name: Longshot

attributes.content: Are Sarkaz born and bred in Londinium, who have never left the city, still considered Victorians?
attributes.name: Longshot

attributes.text: To be honest, I've never really thought about that question.
\nThe Sarkaz who called himself Longshot never yelled or shouted, but the rowdy, chattering chamber went dead quiet as he spoke.
\nI looked at the people all around me, paying special attention to the nobles' expressions.

Those who had long made up their minds on the issue didn't feel like speaking up. As for those who hadn't, the more nervous of them had their eyes darting about, waiting for someone else to speak up first.
\nBut me? I was part of the third kind of people. I didn't have to make up my mind, because Vina'd do it for me.
\nSo that day, all I had to do was wait for her answer.
Just like the time I was up on the city walls, watching the Sarkaz troops leave the city, waiting for her to give me an answer.
I don't think I'm ever going to forget that sight, so long as I live.
\nBack then, I also had a question for Vina: Why're we allowing those Sarkaz who killed Baird to leave with so much pomp and circumstance?

attributes.content: <p=1>Atop Londinium's Walls</><p=2>October 8th, 1098, 8:48 P.M.</>
attributes.name: group_location_stamp

attributes.content: The Sarkaz troops are leaving.
The airship's shadow looms over the silent, orderly soldiers, the Lifebone tearing ripples through the dark clouds hanging above the ruins outside the city.
Vina stands atop the walls, quietly watching them march into the distance. Not too long ago, they were tearing apart her home.
The land is scarred and slick with blood.
How many years will it take to recover from the wounds Amnannam left on Londinium?
I don't know what you and the Doctor talked about, Vina, but there's still time to beat the shite out of all those bastards!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Our men and the boys from the ducal alliance are still waiting down at the foot of the walls. Just—
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Hannah, we're the ones who most need to stay calm right now.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I'd like more than any of you to keep them here... But truth be told, we simply can't do it.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: The dukes' main fleets haven't retreated too far away, Delphine.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Dagda's right! They can hem and haw all they like, but once we start the fight again, they'll have to help us out, even if it's just keeping up pretenses.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Then? Are you going to let these people who fought so hard to survive the war just throw their lives away?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Don't forget the ceasefire agreement. Now's not the time to act recklessly.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: All you ever say is 'don't, don't, don't'! Screw this! Screw it all!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: I can't take it any longer!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: (Choking back tears) All those people... Our friends... Baird...
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Indra stays not a moment longer. She fears she cannot stop herself from sliding down the walls to join the crowd below.
She fears she cannot stop herself from leading the charge, pulling her battle-worn yet battle-hungry fellows back into the fray.
Hannah...
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: She's been bottling herself up this whole time. Don't worry, Vina. I'll go keep an eye on her.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: She's just venting. She's not the foolhardy type.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Vina. Why're we allowing those Sarkaz who killed Baird to leave with so much pomp and circumstance?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: This is the best the Doctor and Wiš'adel could get us.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Londinium cannot withstand another war. There's... There's enough dead already.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: You know this, Vina.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: *sigh* Tell the Exemplars, no rash action from anyone—
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Doctor?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.options: Rhodes Island received a few invitations from the dukes.
They want us to sit in on the post-war conference on handling Londinium.

attributes.content: Handling... You mean before all the Sarkaz are even gone?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Are they really in such a rush?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I don't think the city as it is now is willing to play ball with their machinations.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.options: They realized that too.;That's why they chose you.

attributes.content: Hmph...
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: This is my home, Doctor.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Made your decision, Vina?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Wasn't it made the moment we lead the Exemplars on our charge into the city?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: They know it, and I do too.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: It's not something to take lightly, but you have my full support.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.options: Then Rhodes Island will 'attend' the conference.;We'll stand by your side.

attributes.content: Thank you, Doctor.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I suppose you're saying the biggest challenge is yet to come?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Hah, I'm supremely curious as to what they'll spew out of those pretty little mouths of theirs.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.options: We'll meet you as soon as we can.

attributes.content: Coming home's not always easy, is it?
attributes.name: Vina
